items.title: Trump will be joined by Rubio and Witkoff in meeting with Putin
items.standfirst: The expected one-on-one meeting between President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin, which was originally just going to involve translators, has expanded to include U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff and Secretary of State Marco Rubio and other Russian officials. CBS News' Nancy Cordes and Samantha Vinograd have more details.

items.title: What’s At Stake At The Trump-Putin Summit In Alaska?
items.standfirst: Presidents Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin will meet in Anchorage, Alaska, in a bid to reach a meaningful peace settlement to Russia’s three-year-long war on Ukraine. Few believe that Friday’s summit in Alaska will pave the way for a breakthrough. Russia and Ukraine remain far apart – with the…

items.title: 🔴 Trump-Putin Ukraine peace summit live: Follow FRANCE 24’s special coverage
Trump says he wants to see a ceasefire and ‘won’t be happy if it’s not today’ – as it happened
items.standfirst: Trump-Putin summit live updates: US and Russian leaders to meet in Alaska to discuss ending Ukraine warUS president says Russia needs to show willingness to seriously talk about the end of the war in Ukraine, as he travels to meeting in Anchorage, AlaskaAsked if his conversation with Trump will cover territorial issues, Trump says:“They’ll be discussed, but I’ve got to let Ukraine make that decision, and I think they’ll make a proper decision, but I’m not here to negotiate for Ukraine. I’m here to get them at a table. “I noticed he’s bringing a lot of business people from Russia, and that’s good.I like that because they want to do business, but they’re not doing business until we get the war stopped.” Continue reading...
items.content: Trump-Putin summit live updates: US and Russian leaders to meet in Alaska to discuss ending Ukraine warUS president says Russia needs to show willingness to seriously talk about the end of the war in Ukraine, as he travels to meeting in Anchorage, AlaskaAsked if his conversation with Trump will cover territorial issues, Trump says:“They’ll be discussed, but I’ve got to let Ukraine make that decision, and I think they’ll make a proper decision, but I’m not here to negotiate for Ukraine. I’m here to get them at a table. “I noticed he’s bringing a lot of business people from Russia, and that’s good.I like that because they want to do business, but they’re not doing business until we get the war stopped.” Continue reading...

items.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine is "counting on America" to find path to peace in U.S.-Russia talks
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reiterated that it's "time to end the war" ahead of a high-stakes summit between the U.S. and Russia on Friday. Lesia Vasylenko, a member of the parliament of Ukraine, tells CBS News 24/7 that "the hopes are high" for today's talks.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reiterated that it's "time to end the war" ahead of a high-stakes summit between the U.S. and Russia on Friday. Lesia Vasylenko, a member of the parliament of Ukraine, tells CBS News 24/7 that "the hopes are high" for today's talks.

items.title: Examining Trump and Putin's differing goals for high-stakes Alaska summit
items.standfirst: President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin will each bring differing ideas about ending the war in Ukraine at Friday's summit in Alaska. Retired Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster joins CBS News 24/7 to discuss Mr. Trump's history with Putin, and what to expect from today's talks.

items.title: Trump speaks aboard Air Force One while enroute to summit with Putin
items.standfirst: President Trump spoke with reporters while aboard Air Force One ahead of his summit in Alaska with Russian President Vladimir Putin, doubling down that there will be "very severe" consequences for Russia if a peace deal is not reached with Ukraine. CBS News' Willie James Inman and Ramy Inocencio have the latest details.
items.content: President Trump spoke with reporters while aboard Air Force One ahead of his summit in Alaska with Russian President Vladimir Putin, doubling down that there will be "very severe" consequences for Russia if a peace deal is not reached with Ukraine. CBS News' Willie James Inman and Ramy Inocencio have the latest details.

items.title: Trump and Putin set to meet without President Zelensky present
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin meet in Alaska today for critical talks on the war in Ukraine. Ahead of the summit, Trump alluded to a possible “swapping of territories” as part of a larger ceasefire deal, but neither Russia nor Ukraine is interested in ceding land. Here is what you need to know about the key regions in Ukraine claimed by Russia. France24 Correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports from Kyiv.
items.content: US President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin meet in Alaska today for critical talks on the war in Ukraine. Ahead of the summit, Trump alluded to a possible “swapping of territories” as part of a larger ceasefire deal, but neither Russia nor Ukraine is interested in ceding land. Here is what you need to know about the key regions in Ukraine claimed by Russia. France24 Correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports from Kyiv.

items.title: Trump leaves on Air Force One to meet Putin for Ukraine talks in Alaska
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump insisted Thursday he would not be intimidated by Russia's Vladimir Putin ahead of a rare, high-stakes summit on Ukraine in Alaska on Friday that marks Putin’s first visit to Western soil since the 2022 invasion. The summit comes as Moscow made fresh battlefield gains and Kyiv warned of a “personal victory” for the Kremlin leader. Charlotte Lam tells us more.
items.content: US President Donald Trump insisted Thursday he would not be intimidated by Russia's Vladimir Putin ahead of a rare, high-stakes summit on Ukraine in Alaska on Friday that marks Putin’s first visit to Western soil since the 2022 invasion. The summit comes as Moscow made fresh battlefield gains and Kyiv warned of a “personal victory” for the Kremlin leader. Charlotte Lam tells us more.

items.title: Putin praises Trump’s efforts to end Ukraine war
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump and Russia's Vladimir Putin are set to meet on Friday in Alaska for a rare, high-stakes summit on Ukraine, marking Putin’s first visit to Western soil since the 2022 invasion. The summit comes as Moscow made fresh battlefield gains and Kyiv warned of a “personal victory” for the Kremlin leader. France24's Wassim Cornet reports.
items.content: US President Donald Trump and Russia's Vladimir Putin are set to meet on Friday in Alaska for a rare, high-stakes summit on Ukraine, marking Putin’s first visit to Western soil since the 2022 invasion. The summit comes as Moscow made fresh battlefield gains and Kyiv warned of a “personal victory” for the Kremlin leader. France24's Wassim Cornet reports.

clusters.title: Israeli minister posts video online confronting Palestinian detainee in his prison cell – as it happened
clusters.neutral_headline: Israeli minister taunts jailed Palestinian leader
bullet_summary: Footage of the visit shared on social media on Thursday showed the minister making threatening remarks to the 66-year-old
Reported by Guardian World, France24, Al Jazeera and others

items.title: Israeli minister posts video online confronting Palestinian detainee in his prison cell – as it happened
items.standfirst: Far-right national security minister Itamar Ben Gvir posts video showing him confronting Marwan Barghouti, who has spent more than 20 years in Israeli custodyAt least 16 Palestinian people, including five aid seekers, have been killed in Israeli attacks on Gaza since dawn, Al Jazeera is reporting, citing medical sources.Here are some of the latest images being sent to us over the newswires from Gaza: Continue reading...
items.content: Far-right national security minister Itamar Ben Gvir posts video showing him confronting Marwan Barghouti, who has spent more than 20 years in Israeli custodyAt least 16 Palestinian people, including five aid seekers, have been killed in Israeli attacks on Gaza since dawn, Al Jazeera is reporting, citing medical sources.Here are some of the latest images being sent to us over the newswires from Gaza: Continue reading...

items.title: Far-right Israeli minister taunts jailed Palestinian leader in prison visit
items.standfirst: Itamar Ben-Gvir posts video footage showing him making threatening remarks to a gaunt Marwan BarghoutiIsrael’s national security minister, Itamar Ben-Gvir, has posted video footage in which he is seen taunting the imprisoned Palestinian leader Marwan Barghouti in jail, prompting strong condemnation from Barghouti’s family and Palestinian leaders.The 13-second clip shows Ben-Gvir, a far-right politician on whom the UK and several other countries imposed sanctions this year for incitement to violence against Palestinians, making threatening remarks to Barghouti while Israel’s prisons minister, Kobi Yaakobi, an ally of Ben-Gvir stands nearby. Continue reading...
items.content: Itamar Ben-Gvir posts video footage showing him making threatening remarks to a gaunt Marwan BarghoutiIsrael’s national security minister, Itamar Ben-Gvir, has posted video footage in which he is seen taunting the imprisoned Palestinian leader Marwan Barghouti in jail, prompting strong condemnation from Barghouti’s family and Palestinian leaders.The 13-second clip shows Ben-Gvir, a far-right politician on whom the UK and several other countries imposed sanctions this year for incitement to violence against Palestinians, making threatening remarks to Barghouti while Israel’s prisons minister, Kobi Yaakobi, an ally of Ben-Gvir stands nearby. Continue reading...

items.title: Far-right Israeli minister taunts jailed Palestinian leader in prison visit
items.standfirst: Israel’s far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir released a video on Friday showing him taunting Israel’s most prominent Palestinian detainee, Marwan Barghouti, a senior Fatah figure, in his jail cell. The Palestinian Authority's foreign ministry denounced the confrontation as "an unprecedented provocation". Charlotte Lam tells us more.
items.content: Israel’s far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir released a video on Friday showing him taunting Israel’s most prominent Palestinian detainee, Marwan Barghouti, a senior Fatah figure, in his jail cell. The Palestinian Authority's foreign ministry denounced the confrontation as "an unprecedented provocation". Charlotte Lam tells us more.

The Palestinian Authority's foreign ministry denounced the confrontation as "an unprecedented provocation".
items.content: Israel’s far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir released a video on Friday showing him taunting Israel’s most prominent Palestinian detainee, Marwan Barghouti, a senior Fatah figure, in his jail cell. The Palestinian Authority's foreign ministry denounced the confrontation as "an unprecedented provocation".

items.title: Palestinians condemn Israel’s Ben-Gvir over Marwan Barghouti threat
items.standfirst: Palestinian officials have condemned far-right Israeli National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir’s taunting visit to the jail cell of long-imprisoned Fatah leader Marwan Barghouti. Footage of the visit shared on social media on Thursday showed the minister making threatening remarks to the 66-year-old. France24 Noga Tarnopolsky reports the latest.
items.content: Palestinian officials have condemned far-right Israeli National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir’s taunting visit to the jail cell of long-imprisoned Fatah leader Marwan Barghouti. Footage of the visit shared on social media on Thursday showed the minister making threatening remarks to the 66-year-old. France24 Noga Tarnopolsky reports the latest.

items.title: Court lifts block on Trump’s mass firings at top US consumer watchdog
items.standfirst: Judge previously blocked president from laying off 1,500 employees at the Consumer Financial Protection BureauA federal appeals court set the stage for the Trump administration to resume firings at the top US consumer watchdog, ruling in a split decision that a lower court lacked jurisdiction in temporarily blocking the mass layoffs.The ruling will not take immediate effect, the court said on Friday, to allow lawyers representing workers at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and consumer groups to file for a review of the case by the full circuit court of appeals for the District of Columbia. Continue reading...
items.content: Judge previously blocked president from laying off 1,500 employees at the Consumer Financial Protection BureauA federal appeals court set the stage for the Trump administration to resume firings at the top US consumer watchdog, ruling in a split decision that a lower court lacked jurisdiction in temporarily blocking the mass layoffs.The ruling will not take immediate effect, the court said on Friday, to allow lawyers representing workers at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and consumer groups to file for a review of the case by the full circuit court of appeals for the District of Columbia. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The Trump administration is considering using funds from the US Chips Act to take a stake in Intel Corp., according to people familiar with the discussions, part of efforts to rescue the embattled chipmaker and shore up domestic semiconductor manufacturing.
items.content: The Trump administration is considering using funds from the US Chips Act to take a stake in Intel Corp., according to people familiar with the discussions, part of efforts to rescue the embattled chipmaker and shore up domestic semiconductor manufacturing.

items.title: Intel shares jump after report says Trump administration looking at stake
items.standfirst: Market value passes $104bn despite White House saying claims of talks to invest in factories are ‘speculation’Shares in Intel have jumped 7.4% after it was reported that the Trump administration is considering taking a stake in the struggling US chipmaker.The potential investment, which would be paid for by the US government, would be used to develop Intel’s factory hub in Ohio, according to Bloomberg. It would also help shore up the chipmaker’s finances at a time when Intel has been slashing jobs as part of a wider cost-cutting drive. Continue reading...
items.content: Market value passes $104bn despite White House saying claims of talks to invest in factories are ‘speculation’Shares in Intel have jumped 7.4% after it was reported that the Trump administration is considering taking a stake in the struggling US chipmaker.The potential investment, which would be paid for by the US government, would be used to develop Intel’s factory hub in Ohio, according to Bloomberg. It would also help shore up the chipmaker’s finances at a time when Intel has been slashing jobs as part of a wider cost-cutting drive. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump Administration Said to Discuss US Taking Stake in Intel
items.standfirst: The Trump administration is in talks with Intel Corp. to have the US government take a stake in the beleaguered chipmaker, according to people familiar with the plan, in the latest sign of the White House’s willingness to blur the lines between state and industry.
items.content: The Trump administration is in talks with Intel Corp. to have the US government take a stake in the beleaguered chipmaker, according to people familiar with the plan, in the latest sign of the White House’s willingness to blur the lines between state and industry.

• The investment would help domestic semiconductor manufacturing

• The investment aims to rescue the struggling chipmaker

items.title: Global plastic talks collapse as countries remain deeply divided
items.standfirst: Global talks to develop a landmark treaty to end plastic pollution have once again failed. The UN negotiations, the sixth round of talks in just under three years, were due to end on Thursday but countries continued to negotiate into the night in the hopes of breaking a deadlock. Peter O'Brien tells us more.
items.content: Global talks to develop a landmark treaty to end plastic pollution have once again failed. The UN negotiations, the sixth round of talks in just under three years, were due to end on Thursday but countries continued to negotiate into the night in the hopes of breaking a deadlock. Peter O'Brien tells us more.

items.title: Tropical storm turns into Hurricane Erin as it approaches Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands
items.standfirst: Hurricane is predicted pick up steam toward Florida before veering away from the US mainlandA tropical storm sped up to become Hurricane Erin mid-morning on Friday, as it approached Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands, bringing heavy rains that could cause flooding and landslides on its way to becoming a major Atlantic hurricane.The huge storm was swirling across the Caribbean and is ultimately expected to head towards Florida, picking up speed over warm ocean water, before ultimately veering away from the US mainland. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Emmanuel Macron decries ‘antisemitic hatred’ after memorial tree cut down

bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, France24

items.title: Emmanuel Macron decries ‘antisemitic hatred’ after memorial tree cut down
items.standfirst: French president vows to punish those who felled tree planted in memory of Jewish man tortured to death in 2006The felling of an olive tree planted in memory of a young French Jewish man tortured to death in 2006 caused outrage in France on Friday, with Emmanuel Macron promising to punish an act of “antisemitic hatred”.Politicians across the political spectrum condemned the felling as an attack against the memory of Ilan Halimi, who was kidnapped by a gang of about 20 young people in January 2006 and tortured on a low-income housing estate in the southern Paris suburb of Bagneux. Continue reading...
items.content: French president vows to punish those who felled tree planted in memory of Jewish man tortured to death in 2006The felling of an olive tree planted in memory of a young French Jewish man tortured to death in 2006 caused outrage in France on Friday, with Emmanuel Macron promising to punish an act of “antisemitic hatred”.Politicians across the political spectrum condemned the felling as an attack against the memory of Ilan Halimi, who was kidnapped by a gang of about 20 young people in January 2006 and tortured on a low-income housing estate in the southern Paris suburb of Bagneux. Continue reading...

items.title: Macron pledges action over anti-Semitic 'hatred' after memorial tree vandalised
items.standfirst: President Emmanuel Macron on Friday condemned the felling of a memorial tree for Ilan Halimi, a Jewish man tortured to death in 2006, calling it an anti-Semitic act and vowing to punish those responsible amid rising hate crimes in France.
items.content: President Emmanuel Macron on Friday condemned the felling of a memorial tree for Ilan Halimi, a Jewish man tortured to death in 2006, calling it an anti-Semitic act and vowing to punish those responsible amid rising hate crimes in France.

clusters.ai_summary:

• The tree honored Ilan Halimi, a victim of antisemitism
• Macron condemned the act as antisemitic hatred
• The act sparked outrage across the political spectrum
• Macron promised to punish those responsible

clusters.title: Trump and Putin set for high-stakes Alaska summit amid Ukraine tensions
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Putin meet in Alaska amid Ukraine tensions
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Guardian World

items.title: Trump and Putin set for high-stakes Alaska summit amid Ukraine tensions
items.standfirst: Donald Trump is traveling to Alaska for high-stakes talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the war in Ukraine, marking their first one-on-one meeting in six years. Posting “HIGH STAKES!!!” on Truth Social, the U.S. president has amplified expectations and a sense of drama, according to correspondents. Russia’s foreign minister insists Moscow’s stance remains “clear and unambiguous,” while Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky—excluded from the talks—has warned that any decisions made without him will be meaningless. We discuss the implications with former White House Director of European Affairs Anthony Gardner.
items.content: Donald Trump is traveling to Alaska for high-stakes talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the war in Ukraine, marking their first one-on-one meeting in six years. Posting “HIGH STAKES!!!” on Truth Social, the U.S. president has amplified expectations and a sense of drama, according to correspondents. Russia’s foreign minister insists Moscow’s stance remains “clear and unambiguous,” while Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky—excluded from the talks—has warned that any decisions made without him will be meaningless. We discuss the implications with former White House Director of European Affairs Anthony Gardner.

items.title: Putin ready to make Ukraine deal, Trump says before Alaska summit
items.standfirst: US president’s comment that Russian and Ukrainian leaders may have to ‘divvy’ things up likely to raise alarmDonald Trump has said he believes Vladimir Putin is ready to make a deal on the war in Ukraine as the two leaders prepare for their summit in Alaska on Friday, but his suggestion that the Russian leader and Volodymyr Zelenskyy could “divvy things up” may alarm some in Kyiv.The US president, who left the White House on Friday at 7.30am, implied there was a 75% chance of the Alaska meeting succeeding, and that the threat of economic sanctions may have made Putin more willing to seek an end to the war. “HIGH STAKES!!!” he posted on Truth Social as his motorcade idled outside the White House shortly after sunrise in Washington. Continue reading...
items.content: US president’s comment that Russian and Ukrainian leaders may have to ‘divvy’ things up likely to raise alarmDonald Trump has said he believes Vladimir Putin is ready to make a deal on the war in Ukraine as the two leaders prepare for their summit in Alaska on Friday, but his suggestion that the Russian leader and Volodymyr Zelenskyy could “divvy things up” may alarm some in Kyiv.The US president, who left the White House on Friday at 7.30am, implied there was a 75% chance of the Alaska meeting succeeding, and that the threat of economic sanctions may have made Putin more willing to seek an end to the war. “HIGH STAKES!!!” he posted on Truth Social as his motorcade idled outside the White House shortly after sunrise in Washington. Continue reading...

clusters.ai_summary:
• Trump and Putin met in Alaska for a summit
• The summit focused on the Ukraine war
• Zelensky was excluded from the talks
• Russia stated its position remains unchanged
• Trump expressed optimism about a potential deal

bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, France24

items.title: Rescuers search for missing after devastating Kashmir cloudburst
items.standfirst: Rescuers in Kashmir search for survivors after flash floods triggered by a deadly cloudburst claim at least 60 lives.
items.content: Rescuers in Kashmir search for survivors after flash floods triggered by a deadly cloudburst claim at least 60 lives.

items.title: Flash floods kill at least 160 in Pakistan, scores still missing
items.standfirst: Sudden floods and mudslides swept through Pakistan and the disputed region of Kashmir on Thursday, killing at least 160 people, injuring more than 100 and leaving 200 missing, as rescuers searched for survivors amid the debris.
items.content: Sudden floods and mudslides swept through Pakistan and the disputed region of Kashmir on Thursday, killing at least 160 people, injuring more than 100 and leaving 200 missing, as rescuers searched for survivors amid the debris.

clusters.ai_summary:
• A cloudburst triggered flash floods in Kashmir
• Rescuers are searching for survivors
• At least 60 people died
• The floods caused significant damage
• Many people are still missing
